conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graph to determine when a particle might pass through the same position three times within the interval [0, t₁].

The graph shows a v-t curve for a particle moving in a straight line, symmetric about a vertical dashed line, with velocity initially positive, decreasing, crossing zero, becoming negative, then increasing again, and positive by t₁.
When velocity = 0, the particle momentarily stops and changes direction.
Positive velocity means forward motion (increasing position).
Negative velocity means backward motion (decreasing position).
The area under the v-t curve represents displacement.
Region 1 (0 to t_a): Velocity is positive and decreasing, particle moves forward but slowing down, position at t=0 is x₀.
Region 2 (t_a to t_b): Velocity is negative and decreasing, particle moves backward with increasing speed, at t_a particle stops at position x₁ (x₁ > x₀).
Region 3 (t_b to t₁): Velocity is negative but increasing, then becomes positive, particle continues moving backward but starts slowing down, at t_c velocity = 0 again, particle stops.
For a particle to pass through the same position three times, it must travel in one direction, reverse direction, pass the position again, reverse direction again, and pass it a third time.
Scenario 1: Position = x₀ (starting position), first time at t = 0, second time during backward motion (Region 2 or 3), third time during forward motion after t_c.
Scenario 2: Position = some point between x₀ and x₁, first time during forward motion (Region 1), second time during backward motion (Region 2 or 3), third time during forward motion after t_c.

Scenario 3: Position = some point after reaching minimum position, first time during backward motion (Region 2), second time during backward motion (Region 3), third time during forward motion after t_c.

Possible scenarios for the particle to pass through a certain position three times within the time interval [0, t₁] are consistent with the symmetric v-t graph and requirement that the particle changes direction twice.
